levels.title: What is Cybersecurity?
levels.description: An introduction to the field and its importance.

levels.title: The CIA Triad
levels.description: Understand the core principles: Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability.

levels.title: Common Cyber Threats
levels.description: An overview of malware, phishing, and other common attacks.

levels.title: Introduction to Computer Networking
levels.description: Learn the basics of how computers communicate.

levels.title: IP Addresses, Subnets, and DNS
levels.description: Understand the addressing system of the internet.

levels.title: TCP/IP Model
levels.description: Learn the layers of the internet protocol suite.

levels.title: Introduction to Operating Systems
levels.description: The basics of Windows, macOS, and Linux.

levels.title: The Command Line Interface (CLI)
levels.description: Learn to use the terminal in Linux and Windows.

levels.title: Basic Linux Commands
levels.description: Navigate the file system and manage files with commands like ls, cd, and pwd.

levels.title: Users and Permissions in Linux
levels.description: Understand file permissions and user privileges.

levels.title: Introduction to Cryptography
levels.description: The basics of encryption and decryption.

levels.title: Symmetric vs. Asymmetric Encryption
levels.description: Learn the two main types of encryption.

levels.title: Hashing Algorithms (MD5, SHA-256)
levels.description: Understand how hashing is used to verify data integrity.

levels.title: Security Principles: Least Privilege
levels.description: Give users and programs only the access they need.

levels.title: Security Principles: Defense in Depth
levels.description: Layer your security controls.

levels.title: What is a Firewall?
levels.description: Understand how firewalls filter network traffic.

levels.title: Introduction to Virtualization
levels.description: Learn about virtual machines and their use in cybersecurity.

levels.title: Setting up a Virtual Lab (VirtualBox)
levels.description: Create a safe environment for security experiments.

levels.title: Introduction to Python for Security
levels.description: Learn the basics of Python for scripting and automation.

levels.title: Your First Python Security Script
levels.description: Write a simple script, like a port scanner.

levels.title: Cybersecurity Career Paths
levels.description: An overview of roles like analyst, engineer, and penetration tester.

levels.title: Phishing Analysis
levels.description: Learn how to identify and analyze a phishing email.

levels.title: Password Security
levels.description: Understand what makes a strong password and the importance of password managers.

levels.title: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
levels.description: Learn why MFA is crucial for account security.

levels.title: The OSI Model
levels.description: Understand the 7 layers of the Open Systems Interconnection model.

levels.title: Common Network Ports and Protocols
levels.description: Learn about HTTP (80), HTTPS (443), FTP (21), SSH (22), etc.

levels.title: Using Wireshark to Capture Packets
levels.description: Analyze network traffic with the world's most popular packet sniffer.

levels.title: Windows Command Line Basics
levels.description: Learn commands like ipconfig, ping, and netstat.

levels.title: The Windows Registry
levels.description: A high-level overview of this central database for Windows.

levels.title: Introduction to Active Directory
levels.description: Understand the core of enterprise Windows networks.

levels.title: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)
levels.description: Learn how SSL/TLS certificates work.

levels.title: What is a Digital Signature?
levels.description: Understand how to verify the authenticity and integrity of a message.

levels.title: Introduction to Penetration Testing
levels.description: The process of ethical hacking to find vulnerabilities.

levels.title: Reconnaissance Phase
levels.description: The first step: gathering information about a target.

levels.title: Introduction to Nmap
levels.description: Use this powerful tool to scan networks and discover hosts.

levels.title: Social Engineering
levels.description: Understand the art of manipulating people to gain access.

levels.title: Web Application Security Basics
levels.description: An introduction to common web vulnerabilities.

levels.title: The OWASP Top 10
levels.description: An overview of the most critical web application security risks.

levels.title: What is an Exploit?
levels.description: Understand the difference between a vulnerability and an exploit.

levels.title: Setting up Kali Linux
levels.description: Install and navigate the popular penetration testing distribution.

levels.title: Security Certifications Overview (CompTIA, OSCP)
levels.description: A look at popular entry-level and advanced certifications.

levels.title: Threat Modeling
levels.description: A structured approach to identifying and mitigating potential threats.

levels.title: The Cyber Kill Chain
levels.description: A model for understanding the stages of a cyberattack.

levels.title: Introduction to SIEM
levels.description: Understand Security Information and Event Management systems.

levels.title: Reading Log Files
levels.description: Learn to find important security events in system and application logs.

levels.title: Bash Scripting Basics
levels.description: Automate simple tasks in the Linux terminal.

levels.title: PowerShell Basics
levels.description: Automate tasks in the Windows environment.

levels.title: Digital Forensics Basics
levels.description: The process of collecting and analyzing digital evidence.

levels.title: Chain of Custody
levels.description: The importance of documenting the handling of evidence.

levels.title: Steganography
levels.description: The art of hiding data within other files, like images.

levels.title: Network Topologies
levels.description: Understanding star, bus, ring, and mesh network layouts.

levels.title: Switches, Routers, and Hubs
levels.description: Learn the function of these core networking devices.

levels.title: Wi-Fi Security (WEP, WPA, WPA2/3)
levels.description: Understand the evolution and weaknesses of Wi-Fi encryption.

levels.title: The Principle of Attack Surface Reduction
levels.description: Minimize the number of potential entry points for an attacker.

levels.title: Physical Security
levels.description: Understand why physical access is a critical security concern.

levels.title: Incident Response Lifecycle
levels.description: The phases of handling a security incident: Preparation, Identification, Containment, Eradication, Recovery, Lessons Learned.

levels.title: Introduction to Metasploit
levels.description: A powerful framework for developing and executing exploits.

levels.title: Vulnerability vs. Threat vs. Risk
levels.description: Understand the precise definitions of these key terms.

levels.title: Writing a Basic Security Report
levels.description: Learn how to document your findings clearly.

levels.title: Staying Up-to-Date (Blogs, News, Twitter)
levels.description: Cybersecurity is a fast-moving field; learn where to get information.

levels.title: Capture The Flag (CTF) Events
levels.description: An introduction to CTFs as a way to practice skills.

levels.title: Information Gathering with OSINT
levels.description: Use Open-Source Intelligence to gather information.

levels.title: Using Google Dorking
levels.description: Advanced search techniques to find sensitive information.

levels.title: Introduction to Web Proxies (Burp Suite)
levels.description: Intercept and modify web traffic for analysis.

levels.title: Understanding HTTP/HTTPS
levels.description: The protocol of the web and its secure version.

levels.title: Cookies and Session Management
levels.description: How websites keep track of users.

levels.title: Project: Set Up a Secure Home Network
levels.description: Configure your home router with a strong password, guest network, and updated firmware.

levels.title: Project: Basic Vulnerability Scan
levels.description: Use Nmap to scan your virtual lab for open ports and services.

levels.title: Project: Solve a Beginner CTF Challenge
levels.description: Complete a simple challenge on a platform like PicoCTF or Hack The Box.

levels.title: Project: Decrypt a Simple Cipher
levels.description: Write a Python script to decrypt a Caesar cipher.

levels.title: Final Project: Basic Security Audit
levels.description: Perform a basic security audit of a fictional small business network.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: SQL Injection (SQLi)
levels.description: Inject SQL queries to manipulate a database.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
levels.description: Inject malicious scripts into websites viewed by other users.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
levels.description: Trick a user's browser into making an unintended request.

levels.title: Penetration Testing Methodology (PTES)
levels.description: A standard for conducting penetration tests.

levels.title: Advanced Nmap Scanning Techniques
levels.description: Use the Nmap Scripting Engine (NSE) and advanced flags.

levels.title: Vulnerability Scanning with Nessus/OpenVAS
levels.description: Automate the process of finding known vulnerabilities.

levels.title: Exploit Development Basics
levels.description: Understand buffer overflows and how to write a simple exploit.

levels.title: Introduction to Assembly Language (x86)
levels.description: The low-level language essential for reverse engineering.

levels.title: Reverse Engineering with Ghidra/IDA Pro
levels.description: Decompile and analyze binary applications.

levels.title: Malware Analysis: Static Analysis
levels.description: Analyze malware without running it.

levels.title: Malware Analysis: Dynamic Analysis
levels.description: Analyze malware by running it in a safe sandbox environment.

levels.title: Network Forensics
levels.description: Analyze network traffic to investigate a security incident.

levels.title: Memory Forensics with Volatility
levels.description: Analyze a system's memory dump for artifacts.

levels.title: Cloud Security Basics (AWS, Azure, GCP)
levels.description: Understand the unique security challenges of the cloud.

levels.title: AWS Security: IAM and S3 Bucket Policies
levels.description: Control access to resources in Amazon Web Services.

levels.title: Container Security (Docker, Kubernetes)
levels.description: Secure containerized applications.

levels.title: Wireless Network Attacks
levels.description: Crack WPA2, set up evil twins, and other Wi-Fi attacks.

levels.title: Active Directory Attacks
levels.description: Kerberoasting, Pass-the-Hash, and Golden Ticket attacks.

levels.title: Powershell for Offense and Defense
levels.description: Use PowerShell for advanced attack and defense techniques.

levels.title: Threat Intelligence
levels.description: Gather and analyze information about current and potential attackers.

levels.title: Indicators of Compromise (IoCs)
levels.description: Artifacts that indicate a system has been compromised.

levels.title: The MITRE ATT&CK Framework
levels.description: A knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques.

levels.title: Security Automation with Python
levels.description: Write scripts to automate security tasks.

levels.title: Building a Security Operations Center (SOC)
levels.description: The people, processes, and technology of a SOC.

levels.title: Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS)
levels.description: Monitor networks or systems for malicious activity.

levels.title: Application Whitelisting
levels.description: A security approach that only allows trusted applications to run.

levels.title: Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR)
levels.description: Advanced endpoint security solutions.

levels.title: Mobile Application Security (iOS/Android)
levels.description: The unique challenges of securing mobile apps.

levels.title: IoT and OT Security
levels.description: The security of Internet of Things and Operational Technology devices.

levels.title: Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC)
levels.description: Integrate security into the software development process.

levels.title: Static Application Security Testing (SAST)
levels.description: Analyze an application's source code for vulnerabilities.

levels.title: Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST)
levels.description: Test a running application for vulnerabilities.

levels.title: Fuzzing
levels.description: Find vulnerabilities by providing unexpected or random data to an application.

levels.title: Code Review for Security
levels.description: Manually inspect code for security flaws.

levels.title: Threat Hunting
levels.description: Proactively search for threats in your network.

levels.title: Cryptography Deep Dive
levels.description: A deeper look at AES, RSA, and Diffie-Hellman.

levels.title: Post-Exploitation Techniques
levels.description: What to do after you've gained initial access to a system.

levels.title: Privilege Escalation
levels.description: Gain higher-level permissions on a compromised system.

levels.title: Lateral Movement
levels.description: Move from one compromised machine to another within a network.

levels.title: Data Exfiltration
levels.description: Steal data from a network without being detected.

levels.title: Command and Control (C2) Frameworks
levels.description: Use frameworks like Cobalt Strike or Empire.

levels.title: Social Engineering Toolkit (SET)
levels.description: A framework for creating and launching social engineering attacks.

levels.title: Password Cracking with Hashcat/John the Ripper
levels.description: Crack password hashes.

levels.title: Compliance Frameworks (PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR)
levels.description: Understand the requirements of major compliance standards.

levels.title: Risk Assessment and Management
levels.description: Identify, assess, and mitigate security risks.

levels.title: Security Policy and Procedure Development
levels.description: Write the documents that govern an organization's security.

levels.title: Incident Response Playbooks
levels.description: Create step-by-step guides for handling common security incidents.

levels.title: OSINT Deep Dive
levels.description: Advanced techniques for gathering open-source intelligence.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
levels.description: Force a server to make requests on your behalf.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: Insecure Deserialization
levels.description: Exploit how applications handle serialized data.

levels.title: Web Vulnerabilities: XML External Entity (XXE)
levels.description: Attack applications that parse XML input.

levels.title: API Security
levels.description: The unique challenges of securing APIs (OWASP API Top 10).

levels.title: Hardware Hacking Basics
levels.description: An introduction to JTAG, UART, and SPI.

levels.title: Purple Teaming
levels.description: A collaborative approach where red and blue teams work together.

levels.title: Machine Learning for Security
levels.description: Use ML for anomaly detection, malware classification, etc.

levels.title: Adversarial AI
levels.description: Tricking and evading machine learning models.

levels.title: The C2 Matrix
levels.description: A resource for comparing different command and control frameworks.

levels.title: YARA Rules
levels.description: Write rules to identify and classify malware.

levels.title: Network Traffic Analysis with Zeek (Bro)
levels.description: A powerful framework for network security monitoring.

levels.title: Project: Hack The Box Walkthrough
levels.description: Complete a retired machine on Hack The Box and write a report.

levels.title: Project: Malware Analysis Report
levels.description: Perform static and dynamic analysis on a malware sample.

levels.title: Project: Secure a Web Application
levels.description: Find and fix common vulnerabilities in a sample web app.

levels.title: Project: Create a Custom Phishing Campaign
levels.description: Design and (ethically) execute a phishing campaign.

levels.title: Final Project: Full Penetration Test
levels.description: Conduct a full pen test on a small, fictional corporate network.

levels.title: Advanced Exploit Development
levels.description: Bypass modern mitigations like ASLR and DEP.

levels.title: Return-Oriented Programming (ROP)
levels.description: An advanced technique for gaining code execution.

levels.title: Kernel Exploitation
levels.description: Find and exploit vulnerabilities in the operating system kernel.

levels.title: Browser Exploitation
levels.description: The complex art of finding and exploiting vulnerabilities in web browsers.

levels.title: Fuzzing at Scale
levels.description: Use automated fuzzing to discover zero-day vulnerabilities.

levels.title: Hypervisor and VM Escape
levels.description: Break out of a virtual machine to access the host system.

levels.title: Advanced Malware Analysis
levels.description: Defeat packing, obfuscation, and anti-analysis techniques.

levels.title: Developing Custom C2 Frameworks
levels.description: Build your own command and control infrastructure.

levels.title: SCADA and Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Security
levels.description: The unique challenges of securing critical infrastructure.

levels.title: Automotive and Embedded Systems Security
levels.description: The security of cars, IoT devices, and more.

levels.title: Cryptography Attacks
levels.description: Breaking or weakening cryptographic implementations.

levels.title: Side-Channel Attacks
levels.description: Gain information from the physical implementation of a system.

levels.title: Red Team Operations
levels.description: Simulate a real-world adversary to test an organization's defenses.

levels.title: Assume Breach Mentality
levels.description: Design defenses assuming an attacker is already inside.

levels.title: Deception Technology
levels.description: Use honeypots and other decoys to trap attackers.

levels.title: Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Program Development
levels.description: Build a mature threat intelligence capability.

levels.title: Zero Trust Architecture
levels.description: A security model that never trusts and always verifies.

levels.title: Cloud Native Security
levels.description: Securing serverless, containers, and microservices at scale.

levels.title: Offensive AI
levels.description: Using AI to automate and enhance offensive security tasks.

levels.title: Leading a Cybersecurity Team
levels.description: Management, strategy, and leadership for security professionals.

levels.title: The Role of the CISO
levels.description: Understand the responsibilities of a Chief Information Security Officer.

levels.title: Bug Bounty Programs
levels.description: Running or participating in a bug bounty program.

levels.title: Hardware Reverse Engineering
levels.description: A deep dive into analyzing and defeating hardware security.

levels.title: Satellite and RF Hacking
levels.description: The security of radio frequency communications.

levels.title: The Future of Cybersecurity
levels.description: Exploring quantum cryptography, AI-driven defense, and more.

levels.title: Final Project: Discover a Zero-Day Vulnerability
levels.description: Find a previously unknown vulnerability in a piece of software.

levels.title: Final Project: Win a Major CTF
levels.description: Place highly in a competitive, global Capture The Flag event.

levels.title: Final Project: Publish Security Research
levels.description: Present novel research at a security conference like DEF CON or Black Hat.

levels.title: Advanced Red Team tradecraft
levels.description: OPSEC, evasion, and covert operations.

levels.title: Building EDR and Antivirus Evasion
levels.description: Techniques for bypassing modern endpoint security.

levels.title: Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)
levels.description: Automate security and compliance in the cloud.

levels.title: Cloud Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP)
levels.description: The convergence of cloud security tooling.

levels.title: Software Bill of Materials (SBOM)
levels.description: Managing vulnerabilities in your software supply chain.

levels.title: Security as Code
levels.description: Automate security controls, testing, and compliance.

levels.title: Cryptography Engineering
levels.description: The practice of correctly implementing cryptographic systems.

levels.title: Post-Quantum Cryptography
levels.description: Algorithms designed to be resistant to attack by a quantum computer.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Security Analyst
levels.description: Analyze logs and respond to a simulated incident.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Penetration Tester
levels.description: Tackle a live penetration testing scenario.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Security Architect
levels.description: Design a secure architecture for a complex system.

levels.title: Capstone: Develop a new open-source security tool
levels.description: Create and release a tool for the security community.

levels.title: Capstone: Get a CVE assigned
levels.description: Discover and responsibly disclose a vulnerability to get a CVE ID.
